summary: This bill, the "Regular Order for Investments of the Federal Reserve Act," aims to limit the Federal Reserve's investment activities and increase transparency. It mandates the Federal Reserve to submit annual reports on the middle class and small business lending. The bill also restricts the types of securities the Federal Reserve can purchase, prohibiting Treasury bills exceeding 3-year maturities, mortgage-backed securities, and common stock purchases. Additionally, it requires that the Federal Reserve use generally accepted accounting principles and mark-to-market valuations.
